description:
Grow your career at Cedars-Sinai!

At Cedars-Sinai, we're motivated by a collective spirit of innovation and the challenge to continuously improve. Above all, we share a real passion for helping others. Day after day, from department to department, our people give their all to create a community unlike any other. This is just one of the many reasons U.S. News & World Report has named us one of America’s Best Hospitals—and now we invite you to join us and make a difference every single day in service of this outstanding work – excellence and innovation in patient care, research, and community service. From working with a team of dedicated professionals to using state-of-the-art facilities, you’ll have great resources to do something incredible—for yourself, and for others

What will you be doing in this role?

The Environmental Services (EVS) Support Services Supervisor is responsible for providing leadership guidance and directs all work activities of Hospitality Services staff and services, which may include one or more departments. Performs routine quality control inspections and ensures quality standards are met. Ensures that on-going training and performance assessment of employees to maintain and improve employee competencies are being conducted. Creates an atmosphere of open, positive communication throughout the department.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for department staffing schedule and re-evaluation of staffing needs on a daily basis. Collaborates with Manager in the hiring process of employees.
  • Prepares daily schedules and work assignments. Adjusts staffing daily to maintain high productivity, as well as accommodate absences and changes in client needs.
  • Conducts daily documented rounding of the medical center, ancillary, and inpatient units to monitor client Hospitality needs, staff performance and that assigned workflows are completed in a timely manner.
  • Responds to all customer, departmental and staff concerns/requests with urgency and takes necessary corrective action including timely follow-up.
  • Reviews and responds in a timely manner to all business / customer related messages and/or inquires received each day.
  • Effectively communicates with previous lead or supervisor when beginning shift and ending shift to share pertinent operational information related to the shift.
